qas.question: What is the Ganj-i-Sawai unknown for?

context: Every continued in pursuit and managed to overhaul Ganj-i-Sawai, which resisted strongly before eventually striking. Ganj-i-Sawai carried enormous wealth and, according to contemporary East India Company sources, was carrying <a1_0><b8_0>a relative of the Grand Mughal<b8_0/><a1_0/>, though there is no evidence to suggest that it was his daughter and her retinue. The loot from the <a4_0>Ganj-i-Sawai<a4_0/> had a total value between <a0_0><b7_0>£325,000 and <a3_0>£600,000<b7_0/><a3_0/><a0_0/>, including <a5_0><b6_0>500,000<b6_0/> gold and silver pieces<a5_0/>, and has become known as the <a2_0><b9_0>richest ship ever taken by pirates<b9_0/><a2_0/>.
